title: Note
description: The Note component is designed to display contextual messages in various styles, including info, success, warning, and more. Perfect for alerting users or providing helpful tips in your UI. Easily customizable with support for icons and additional styles.

body.raw:
# Note Component The `Note` component is used to display contextual messages with different styles based on the type of note. ## Preview and Code Snippet console.log("Tab clicked:", value)}> Preview Code
This is an informational note. This is a success message. This is a warning message. This is an Normal message.
```tsx import { Note } from '@/components/note'; export default function Example() { return (
This is an informational note. This is a success message. This is a warning message. This is an alert message. This is a helpful tip.
); } ``` ## Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | | ----------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- | -------- | --------------------------------- | | `type` | `none` \| `info` \| `warning` \| `alert` \| `success` \| `tip` | `'none'` | Determines the style of the note. | | `className` | `string` | `''` | Additional CSS classes. | | `hideIcon` | `boolean` | `false` | Hides the note icon when `true`. | | `children` | `ReactNode` | `-` | The content of the note. | ## Usage Steps 1. Import the `Note` component from your components folder. 2. Use the `type` prop to specify the type of note. 3. Optionally, use `hideIcon` to hide the icon. 4. Add your message inside the `` component. ### Example ```tsx Success without an icon! ``` This component helps in displaying contextual messages effectively in your UI.
